entry.et: Latin, from apparare to prepare, from ad- + parare to prepare pare

def.dt: :a set of materials or equipment designed for a particular use
:a group of anatomical or cytological parts functioning together mitotic apparatus
:an instrument or appliance designed for a specific operation
:the functional processes by means of which a systematized activity is carried out the apparatus of society: as
:the organization of a political party or an underground movement

:a cytoplasmic organelle that consists of a stack of smooth membranous saccules and associated vesicles and that is active in the modification and transport of proteins called also Golgi complex see cell illustration
